context: This evaluation assesses how effectively the engineer uses the @emoji-toolkit/size package to implement a task progress dashboard. The criteria focus exclusively on correct usage of package-specific functions and features, not on general coding practices.

checklist.name: Conditional emoji scaling
checklist.description: Uses scaleEmoji() function with appropriate size parameters ('tiny', 'medium', 'large', 'giant') based on progress ranges: 0-33% uses 'tiny', 34-66% uses 'medium', 67-99% uses 'large', 100% uses 'giant'. Must correctly map progress percentages to size categories.

checklist.name: Progress bar creation
checklist.description: Uses createProgressBar() function with correct parameters: fill emoji (ðŸŸ¢), empty emoji (âšª), calculated average progress as decimal (0-1), and length of 10. Must pass the average progress value correctly calculated from all tasks.

checklist.name: Pyramid pattern display
checklist.description: Uses createPyramid() function with celebration emoji (ðŸŽ‰) and height of 3, displayed only when ALL tasks have progress >= 1.0. Must correctly implement the conditional logic to check completion status and call the function appropriately.

checklist.name: Progress calculation logic
checklist.description: Correctly calculates overall progress as arithmetic mean (sum of all task progress values divided by task count) and converts individual task progress from decimals (0-1) to percentages (0-100) by multiplying by 100 and rounding to nearest whole number using Math.round().

checklist.name: Output formatting correctness
checklist.description: Produces output that matches the specified format exactly: 'Task Status:' section with scaled emojis and percentages, 'Overall Progress:' line with progress bar and percentage, and optional celebration pyramid. The visual output must match expected test case outputs including proper emoji scaling, spacing, and newlines.
